<title level="1" right="Rules">[Defensive Abilities](/Rules.aspx?ID=1032)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 69</row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Active offensive abilities usually fit creatures better than defensive abilities do. Save defense increases for creatures that are strongly defense-themed. For martial creatures, something as simple as a shield and Shield Block is usually plenty. Defensive abilities often run the risk of being invisible abilities. For examples of good defensive abilities, look at spells like [_sanctuary_](/Spells.aspx?ID=266) for ideas, or other spells that create interesting protective effects instead of just granting a bonus. If you do want to make a creature defensive, pick one defensive ability rather than several, since stacking up multiple defenses can make for a frustrating fight. One solid style of defensive ability is a mode switch, which causes the creature to get stronger defenses, but limits its attacks, spells, or other offensive options.
</column>

<column gap="medium">
